DA: Bulger foe Rakes poisoned with cyanide, not related to trial

Middlesex District Attorney Marian Ryan said today that Stephen Rakes (left) was murdered by William Camuti, 69, of Sudbury, who poisoned his iced coffee after a real estate deal went awry, leaving the suspect heavily in debt to Rakes. (3:44 p.m.)
  • 7/18 Stephen Rakes, who accused Bulger, found dead  |  Funeral held for Rakes  |  Pictures

Warren: End the ban on gay blood donors

"Blood donation policies should be grounded in science, not ugly and inaccurate stereotypes,” Senator Elizabeth Warren said in a statement to the Department of Health and Human Services. (1:34 p.m.)
  • 7/13 Protest challenges ban on gay donors
  • 6/10/10 Lawmakers push to overturn ban on gay donors

Anthony Weiner (not that one) in text trouble

Another man named Anthony Weiner, he of Revere, is being charged with attempted murder after a man texted his wife, the Salem News reports. (12:56 p.m.)

Bulger: Trial a 'sham,' not taking the stand

Big story: Bulger will not take the stand in trial

James "Whitey" Bulger, will not take the stand, saying in court, "As far as I’m concerned, I didn’t get a fair trial." (12:06 p.m.)

Woman in One Fund scam held on bail

Audrea Gause, 26, was ordered held on $200,000 bail for allegedly receiving $480,000 from the fund after she filed a claim saying she was injured. (1:13 p.m.)

Wholesale gas prices to rise

Regional prices for natural gas rose twice as fast as most of the country in the first half of last year, due in part to a growing demand for the fuel.

The right man for the job

The Patriots were a clown show when Bill Parcells was hired in 1993. More than Bob Kraft, Tom Brady or Bill Belichick, the Tuna is the man who changed the culture of football on Route 1.

Here's one way BPA's linked to infertility
